alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Montour; Northumberland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 7:16PM EDT until September 09 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Columbia, Montour and Northumberland. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 715 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bloomsburg, Berwick, Sunbury, Shamokin, Mount Carmel, Selinsgrove, Danville, Northumberland, Kulpmont, Elysburg, Fairview-Ferndale, Riverside, Trevorton, Shamokin Dam, Catawissa, Marshallton, Hummels Wharf, Mifflinville, Lightstreet and Almedia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
